alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Montgomery (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 4:36PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Carroll and west central Montgomery Counties through 500 PM CST... At 436 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Carrollton, or 9 miles west of Winona, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Winona around 445 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Carrollton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central Mississippi.
